numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some students have relatives who went to a college.
2. Some students have no relatives who went to that college.
3. A student with such a relative is more likely to be admitted to that college than a student without such a relative.
4. The author asks why colleges favor a student who has a relative who went to the same college.
5. Some applicants are in the 70th percentile.
6. Some applicants are in the 90th percentile.
7. An applicant in the 70th percentile is less likely to be admitted than other applicants.
8. An applicant in the 90th percentile is less likely to be admitted than other applicants.
9. Most people here plan to go to college.
11. This situation affects their search for a college that suits them.
12. The author asks whether colleges are too greedy.
